website_summaries.verdict: Powerful filter by a recognizable brand that's available for 30, 50, and 70 gallon tanks.
pros: Delivers five-stage filtration that does a great job removing debris
Includes activated charcoal for toxin removal
Output is adjustable to accommodate fish of different sizes
cons: Some of its plastic components are flimsy

customer_reviews.title: Crap!  Broken, dirty crap!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could give it zero stars. When I opened it, it was dirty and obviously not new, even though it had been repackaged to make it look new. I needed a filter ASAP so I started to put it together. The motor piece had a big piece of plastic broken off. And the seal was missing. And then the whole impeller was missing!!!! This was such crap!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lee James

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Filter
customer_reviews.text: Canister filter quality in a HOB filter! I love the different media and stages of filtration in this unit. The flow adjuster is, thankfully, on the top - not inside the unit or inside the tank like some other brands. Makes it really easy to play with the flow. The flow can be notched down for this to give a moderate flow in a 10 gallon tank to higher flows for bigger tanks. Easy to use, easy to clean - everything slides out individually. Because the filter is compartmentalized, like a canister filter, you can customize your filter media. The only reason I'm not giving this 5 stars is that the unit is a little loud.
customer_reviews.author: Raven Bower

customer_reviews.title: Burnt motor.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this april 20th this year, its now August 6th. The motor has died. It grew algae in the motor i think. The filter material would get so clogged with algae at the top that it would be a trickle of water coming out, and I would clean it out. I did a full clean of the filter two weeks prior to this. It was on my 30 gal guppy tank, tanks been established over a year and this was supposed to be a replacement/ upgrade from the aqueon i had. I think ill end up getting an aquaclear as i have two other established tanks with them. They keep a much better flow as well.
customer_reviews.author: Because Nyx

customer_reviews.title: Too loud, get an aquaclear
customer_reviews.text: This thing filters like a beast. The only con is it is LOUD and needs to be cleaned and rebuilt to get it to quiet back down. The flaw is in the 2-piece impeller design. I don't know why Fluval did this. Other than the noise, I am really happy with its filtering ability. Update: I can no longer make it quiet. I have tried rebuilding it multiple times, and tried every tip that I could find on the internet. This thing is terrible. It's loud enough to Wake the Dead. I'm going to contact the manufacturer to see if there's anything they can do.
customer_reviews.author: K. Klemple

customer_reviews.title: I am amazed as to how good this pump is
customer_reviews.text: I am amazed as to how good this pump is. I have it on a 15 gallon and bought another for a 10 gallon. I always go into overkill on filteration. It is a mild return compared to some others. Which I liked because I use it for the more delicate fish. The water is crystal clear. I like my beta's to have nice tanks instead of just a bowl. Love the indicator on the sponge that lets me know when to change it. It was BLACK. So I really know it is doing its job. It is easy and love the five stages of filtering. LOVE, LOVE, LOVE, this filter!!!
customer_reviews.author: Doris

customer_reviews.title: Broken in less than 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware... this pump is crap. It was nice for a a little while, but it's gone downhill fast. And of course right after my return/exchange window!! I got this on april 15th this year and I've had so many issues. Every water change I'm struggling to get the water to flow back through it, and after tonight's water change, it won't even turn back on. Not even 2 months and it's not working. I've done everything by the book. Have other filters of a different brand that has been doing great on the other side of the tank and on my other tank. This one is literally the worst purchase ever on my tank.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Faulty product
customer_reviews.text: Product worked great for 3 days then it just stopped working this was a replacement as the first one only worked for 15 minutes I have used fluval since 2017 and I noticed I have had to replace them every year so this time instead of not purchasing I went with a larger filter as my fish are fairly big so I purchased a final time and within fifteen minutes it stopped working company did a great job replacing it but the replacement stopped working in 3 days so unfortunately I’ll need to find a new company
customer_reviews.author: Melinda williams

customer_reviews.title: Effective, quiet filter
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Replaced charcoal with more bio media in attempt to replicate trickle box bio filter functions. Using on 5 gallon naturally planted nano-aquarium with 2 small gold fish per information from renegade goldfish breeder that goldfish can live long and well in small containers set up properly. No scolding please. A month into the experiment they are doing well, even appearing to try to breed. Water flow was strong enough I fabricated a cover to redirect and slow the current. There are tutorials on YouTube for using sections of water bottles, but I made mine from sheet plastic for a better look and function.
customer_reviews.author: Eljaybee

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, Efficient and Worth Whatever The Price
customer_reviews.text: I worked at a Petco and pitched Fluval to many customers with little success. Yes they are expensive and while I got this model on sale. I stand by the brand. I raise goldfish and due to their messy nature quality filtration is key. This filter took a tank that was running filterless for over a month and cleaned it within 4 hours. The set up is easy, the indicator is clear when it needs to be changed and it is QUIET! There are different ways to adjust suction and flow and it is the perfect filter for any tank. Choose this series if you want a clean tank fresh or salt.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Great filter but very loud.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this filter. I own the C3 and use it on a smaller tank and I love it so much. Works well and is quite. This one is loud no matter what you do. I’ve checked the impeller and housing everything. I even emailed fluval and they said to return it if everything looks to be working. But if this thing would not be loud it would be a great filter. Easy to clean and add extra media if you don’t want to use the carbon. If fluval changes the design of the pump to make it quite it would be the best filter. Until then that’s a no for me.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: It's good but very noisy after a while
customer_reviews.text: Gets noisy after a few months. New impeller won't fix the noise. In fact it's cheaper to buy a new one every time the impeller gets loud... I mean loud, real loud. I have to turn the filter off when I watch tv and sometimes I get up at night and go downstairs and unplug it. I bought a bunch of filters for it so I'm stuck with it until they are used up. This is my 3rd in 2 years and about 5-6 replacement impellers... It's a good product if they could resolve the noisy impeller
customer_reviews.author: F. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great filter for a minute (update)
customer_reviews.text: This is a Update.... after buying 6 of these filters I'm taking back my original review. One by one they have died. After disassembling and cleaning the impeller constantly to keep the motor running even that has quit helping . It got to where I had to replace 4 of the 6 filters with another brand . The filter is a great concept but the materials being used sub par . I will not buy another fluval hang on back filter .
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: I love this filter
customer_reviews.text: Love this filter! I have a Tidal 55 and this on a 36 gal reef tank. This is the best filter I have used. It does start out loud and I was a bit upset. But...after about a week I could tell the noise level was less. It has gotten MUCH quieter as weeks went on and now its barely noticeable. I guess it needs time to get gooped up or something. So easy to clean. I started with an aqua clear filter which sucked. I have the back of my tank painted black so I have no idea if the red parts show through and are an eyesore.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: High quality filter.
customer_reviews.text: There are very few higher quality hang on backs of this size. They're out there, but not surprisingly cost more. There are significantly cheaper ones that do the same job adequately, but have a lesser design, lesser parts, and way less ease of cleaning. This is the filter you buy when you're not rich, not poor, and don't want to DIY the thing but just want it to work well from the start.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Brown

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I love this filter because it comes already assembled. You just add some parts and in 5 minutes you are ready to install it. The only downside is that there are many parts you will need to buy later to replace. Anyway I am very satisfied and happy with this purchase. UPDATE: It stopped working after 2-3 weeks? I guess I got a defective product? I am returning and replacing for a new one. Let's see. I will update again.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Danny2019

customer_reviews.title: Ingenious design, but GPH seems far overstated
customer_reviews.text: Even set at max flow through clean stock media the flow is fairly weak. Maybe I’ll measure it and test and put up a video, but the flow is way less than my Marineland Magnum which supposedly is only about 30gph faster - even with a micron filter charged with diatomaceous earth in the Marineland which makes it run slower than normal configuration. That said the design is perfect and I wish they made a larger stronger one like a C6 and C8 or similar.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thanks Fluval
customer_reviews.text: This is my back up filter in case of power outage.. It is simple to hook-up simple to clean and yes very quiet and easy to operate.. Just set it up hang on the side and your done. I guess if you have a small tank it will work fine.. Remember always buy more than your minimal rating or you will be sorry.. I hook this up to a battery inverter in the event of a power failure to at least keep my 100 gallon tank with some sort of filtration. This was an issue with Hurricane Irma.. All my fish and corals survived and doing great.. Thanks Fluval
customer_reviews.author: RPR dude

customer_reviews.title: Best HOB filter I have seen!
customer_reviews.text: This filter is very advanced for a hang on back filter. It works like a sum as you have chemical, mechanical, and biological filtration options. I especially like the trickle filter for biological filtration. I have a feeling my seachem stability is more effective when I put it right into the bio filtration rather than into the tank or sponge part of the filter. The C4 also has a great high flow rate, I use one on a 30 gallon with African cichlid juices and another on a 40 gallon recieving/quarantine Tank. They are my favorite filter to clean, even over their close relative the aquaclear filters. There is slightly more ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Logan Gassen

customer_reviews.title: Versatile design and not too noisy
customer_reviews.text: I am able to add a layer of carbon foam to the foam pad section. That leaves more room in the media compartment for ceramic media (Matrix etc.). As others have stated, the odd little foam dispersion pad over the trickle compartment is easily clogged and not easily cleaned. I eventually tossed it and I'm not paying the $$$ for replacements. Not as quiet as a Fluval AquaClear, but not too noisy either. Large size and incredible flow rate make it my HOB filter choice for any tank 20-50 gal size.
customer_reviews.author: HaulinAshe

customer_reviews.title: Great design CRIPPLED by LOUD motor/impeller
customer_reviews.text: Two stars instead of one ONLY because I think there are great ideas here. Love the large media capacity and the fact that the water flows back to front. It could be a GREAT HOB filter but is CRIPPLED by a crappy loud motor/impeller. I bought two of these for temporary holding tanks while I redo my main display. BOTH were incredibly loud - a rattling noise that sounds like something is broken. Googled all the tricks to fix it - nothing worked. I'm returning both (Amazon was great about it, as usual) and replacing with the Seachem Tidal 55. Wish I'd found out about the Seachem Tidal filters sooner!
customer_reviews.author: don_chuwish

customer_reviews.title: I like the compartments on the C4
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Aquaclear filters for a long time and thought I'd give the C4 a try. I like the compartments on the C4. I can remove the mechanical media without needing to mess with the other media. The trade off though is the flexibility in what shape media you can load. The C4 fits the rim of a 40 breeder easier compared to the Aquaclear 70. I'm not sure I like the telescoping inlet. The whole filter syphons out once you drain your tank lower than the joint. I'd rather be able to do a 50% water change without the need to prime the filter again to get it started.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Justice

customer_reviews.title: Product works great. Broken case in shipping.
customer_reviews.text: Product works great.....after replacing the casing which was broken during shipping. After waiting a week to put up the aquarium, because we didn't have a filter, we received the product but it had a broken casing. Instead of shipping it back and waiting for a new one I tried to fix the casing with glue and silicon. Didn't work. My bad, so I had to order a used casing because I couldn't return the one I tried to fix. Good product and very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Gibby

customer_reviews.title: Running strong for 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I currently own and are using 2 C4s in my 55 gallon tank. (going on 2 years now) and I must say, these are the best HOBs I have owned. Every once and a while, the impeller in my HOB gets noisy. I am able to correct this by cleaning and re-seating It. To date, I have not replaced any hardware on these HOBS. Buy a tiny pipe cleaner brush to clean inside the impeller housing, making sure you do not bend the pin while cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: jp

customer_reviews.title: Extremely impressed
customer_reviews.text: Extremely impressive cleaning power and great flow, i cleaned my glass of some green build up (I know it should have never got that bad but I've been slacking).. anyways, the water was bad after I got done with the glass, couldn't even see thorough it, when I woke up the next morning it was crystal clear, the aquaclear I had doesn't even come close to the cleaning quality of this fluval C2, I highly recommend this filter, and really any fluval equipment you can buy, I have never been disappointed with anything fluval makes..
customer_reviews.author: CHristopher

customer_reviews.title: Great filter
customer_reviews.text: Is quiet if the water in the tank stays full. Using this in a turtle tank and it is working well to keep the water clear in a 20gal tank. Doesn't pull much from the bottom of the tank, which in my case has no gravel or anything besides the remains of turtle poop and shedding shutes. I think I may have to replace and clean the filter a bit more often because I'm using it for a turtle and have heat lamps that grow algae. The little red bobble is up within an hour of rinsing out the filter.. still love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well Engineered Hang-on Filter
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well engineered hang-on filter. Unlike others, it's designed to use multiple filter mediums simultaneously. Other hang-on filters only use a blue-bonded filter pad with a very small amount of carbon medium, and some with a cylindrical bio wheel, which fills with water and then stops turning. The Fluval C4 has three separate chambers for different medium, one of which is a bio filter. It also uses more than just carbon medium, all contained in a neat fitting bag. I highly recommend this filter.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Unit burned
customer_reviews.text: The good side product make water crystal clear , quite and easy to maintain. I bought this product on July 2018, just few month ago ...Now is November 5/2018, yesterday the electric turn off I ran down stair in one minute to unplug the unit from the surge protection outlet . There was more than half of the water left in the unit but the motor was hot. With in 5 minutes the electric back and all other equipment worked right except the filter was burned....... ***** this always happened if the electric off all the whole area.****
customer_reviews.author: Nongluck Poopatanapong

customer_reviews.title: Great design, great filter
customer_reviews.text: So far I am loving this filter. I returned a Seachem Tidal 110 due to major bypass issues, and replaced it with this. This fluval design is 100% better. Looks way better in the tank and seems to be doing a great job. I couple this with a canister filter on my 55 gallon tank and the water is Crystal. It has only been a few days, so I will come back with an update, but super happy so far
customer_reviews.author: Sj

customer_reviews.title: Noisy
customer_reviews.text: Yes its very noisy. I replaced a Marineland filter with this one and I regret that now. The Fluval is very noisy so it has to be switched off at night since this tank is in my daughters room. When you switch it back on it takes a lot of work to get it running again. It has to be primed every morning as it wont pull the water up by itself.
customer_reviews.author: Jupefly

customer_reviews.title: Good product has a 'break in' period
customer_reviews.text: Works well no issues with leaks product was shipped quickly and arrived with no damage. To further explain my header this filter does have a break in period. When i first powered and primed my filter there was a slight motor noise but it went away within a hour or so. The other issue was the funnel that poors water over the biological media barely flowed. After a day the funnel built pressure and is following well. I own a c2 on a 20 gallon long very happy with this filter. Its designed like a german car. Sexy as hell but a little over engineered.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best HOB filters on the market
customer_reviews.text: The Fluval C series filters are hands down the best hang on the back filters that you can get. They are very similar to the aquaclear filters but work even better with less bypass. Run very quiet and both sizes are still running strong after a long time of use. have the c3 on a 20gal tall and the c2 on a 10gal.
customer_reviews.author: Kerschnickitty

customer_reviews.title: Good filters.
customer_reviews.text: Love these filters, used them on all three tanks I have because the competitors were by and large junk. In fact, the first one we bought as a replacement triggered our decision to replace all of our filters with these. Easy to maintain, quiet, and work very well. Only caveat to this review: I had to replace an impeller on one filter within a month, but I wrote that off as a failed experiment in keeping a Koi in an indoor tank. Bad idea, they can be pretty destructive. Overall very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Porter

customer_reviews.title: Cleans well BUT Loud noise from motor.
customer_reviews.text: Does a fine job cleaning the tank, the tank is doing wonderfully. Cleaning is fairly easy, although lots of parts to clean but this is normal. The Major drawback for me is that it makes a very loud and very annoying grinding noise from the motor. I'm currently looking to purchase an external canister filter to replace this Fluval that I can keep under the tank cabinet. This noise is driving me crazy. The only way i can make it tolerable in the room is with a fan running that masks some of the grinding noise.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony W. Larson

customer_reviews.title: Died after 4 months!
customer_reviews.text: This was great at the beginning. I have 18 aquariums, from salt to freshwater, so I know what to do and not to do with a filter. I just did a water change and this filter no longer turns on. Its a burnt out motor. bummer
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Fullen

customer_reviews.title: Noisy after four months.
customer_reviews.text: When I first installed this filter on my 29 gallon aquarium, I loved it. It does a great job and the water is crystal clear, but after four months this thing is noisy, I mean loud noisy. I have my 29 gal setting here in my living room, and it is very distracting how loud the Fluval C4 is. I have cleaned the motor and impeller, lubricated it with vaseline as others have suggested, and it does help the noise, but a couple of days later it is just as loud and noisy as before. Ordering new parts, motor and impeller is not much cheaper then buying a whole new filter. But this time I am going with an Aquaclear.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin Eugene Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Arrived great, doin it’s job. Quiet.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Arrived quickly and intact. No scratches, chips, missing parts like others I’ve read. Instructions are straight forward. I got it for a 20 tall, so even on low, it’s a strong current, but with a lit up air wand covering the whole back wall, bubbles going into the filter are slowing it down some too. I plan to upgrade tanks in the near future, so I’ll be ready with good bacteria in this baby when I do :). Thanks Amazon and Fluval.
customer_reviews.author: Sassy

customer_reviews.title: They set the standard for aquarium care!
customer_reviews.text: Wow this is the best hob filter I've ever used! When it comes to aquarium care I think fluval sets the standard. They truly have the best products out there. This filter is so easy to use, they really thought of everything. Now my parameters are great when they were not with my old filter. Fluval customer for life here! Cant wait to try the g6 on my 125 gal.
customer_reviews.author: Chris krohe

customer_reviews.title: Great Filter
customer_reviews.text: This is a serious aquarium filter. Using it as a replacement for one that came with an earlier tank. Water is crystal clear and our readings are stable. Cleaned it once so far after 4 weeks of use. Easy enough process, though certainly more steps than just swapping out a filter. It does take a little effort to get it primed (used a cup to pour some water into the top until it caught up) and you can hear it if you listen, but I would certainly not call it loud or annoying and other posts suggest a little Vaseline on the gears to solve both problems. I haven't tried it yet, but I expect it would work.
customer_reviews.author: vanoden

customer_reviews.title: :) So HAPPY!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this filter. We purchased the C2. We had been using a sponge filter and air pump for a while, but were having issues with water quality and cloudiness. I wish I had switched to this sooner. Water quality and clarity cleared up completely in less than a week. We are using it on a 10 gallon tank. I LOVE that the different filtering stages are separate and can be replaced/cleaned separately. Super happy with my purchase. Was at the end of my rope. I have had other "comparable filters" before. One with that stupid bio-wheel. HATED THEM! I resisted getting a "filter" other than the sponge filter because of those experiences. Glad I got this one.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren M. Walters

customer_reviews.title: I really liked the multi step filtration and the fact that I ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been through two of these in the past five months. My second one, the replacement to my original, just broke again. I believe this time was due to a power outage. The filter struggles to restart after being stopped, so when the power returns, the motor runs dry and eventually burns out. When it runs, it works well. A little noisy, but I used some online tutorials to make it a little quieter. I really liked the multi step filtration and the fact that I could have polyfoam, the carbon filter and bio cubes in there.
customer_reviews.author: A.P.

customer_reviews.title: Great when not shipped broken
customer_reviews.text: I have had one of these running for a few years now and it is great. The reason I took a star is I ordered another thru Amazon(first one I got from petsmart) and the motor housing is cracked where it is threaded to fit to the filter. So these are great when they dont come broken.
customer_reviews.author: jesse may

customer_reviews.title: Excellent filter
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent filter. I have used AquaClear quite a bit in the past 20 years and while I like them, this design is better. You can get at the mechanical filtration without taking the rest out. I can't tell you how big of a deal this is for someone like me who does frequent filter maintenance water changes due to the amount that I feed my fish. There's a lot more than that to like about this filter but if you're on the fence I would say you get it. I just ordered a second for another tank and will probably be ordering another pair soon.
customer_reviews.author: Dan R.

customer_reviews.title: Impeller was chipped from the edge
customer_reviews.text: I got the Fluval C2 Power Filter installed. As soon as got it primed its immediately started making a loud noise. Then, I decided to remove and inspect all its parts. I confirmed that the Fluval C2 Power Filter impeller was chipped from the edge, you can check this on the attached picture. I wondering that it might be the issue that some people have experienced with Fluval Power Filters. I'm returning this defective Fluval C2 Power Filter and Amazon is going to send me a replacement. I'm quite concerned about Fluval's quality control (QC). I will update this as soon as I get the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Carolina F

customer_reviews.title: awesome filter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 20long because I'm excessive, but it is a fantastic filter. I love that each piece of media is separate so you can remove what you don't need or add something else in. the impeller on mine is slightly rickety but nothing awfully loud. I put a diy sponge over the intake and it runs just as well and doesn't suck up anyone or anything it shouldn't. great product
customer_reviews.author: Bryson

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Aqua Clear
customer_reviews.text: I love this filter! I have it running side by side with the older Aqua Clear model. Maintenance is easy. The thing that I like best about this filter is the way that the outlet aims water along the surface creating better agitation at the surface than the Aqua Clear, which just shoots the stream down into the tank.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Product works great but doesn’t last long enough
customer_reviews.text: I use Fluval filters in all of my tanks and they work better than any other brand I’ve ever used. Unfortunately I find myself replacing them every 18 months or so because the motor burns out. They should last longer - but I continue to buy them because they work so well until they stop working
customer_reviews.author: Tana Miller

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations
customer_reviews.text: Love the recirculating filtration to give full filtration but allowing the outflow to be adjusted. I have not noise issues, super quiet. I am replacing my Aqueon 50. I was never super thrilled with the Aqueon, the filtration is pathetic compared to the Fluval. I am running the filters on a 40 gal breeder and love it so far, will remove the Aqueon once the new filter gets a bio load. I added some Fluval biomax cylinders on top of the carbon since there was alot of extra space. Could not be happier. Only issue I had was, I had to move my tank a little farther from the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Loved it.
customer_reviews.text: Ok so i was leary about purchasing this filter with all the complaing of the imbalanced impellar causing alot of noise. But i decided to take a chance with it. Ive had it just over a week and it's been running like a champ. Nice, quiet filter. Will definitely buy another to replace older filters when they play out.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton Scott

customer_reviews.title: Sold me a used damaged returned item!
customer_reviews.text: This is what I get for ordering a returned item from the warehouse This item should have been inspected and NOT RESOLD TO ANYONE! would have flooded my livingroom with almost all of my 75 gallons of my aquarium had I installed this trash! Hopefully my issue will be resolved as promised!
customer_reviews.author: jeff kendrick

customer_reviews.title: The system lends itself a variety of setting up filter media
customer_reviews.text: I had it out of the box and got the media cleaned and installed and is in my sump system just for extra filtration before going back in my tank.Its working really well the new design lends itself to a variety of filter media.And is very quiet Pretty happy with the system so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Most excellent filter
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the C2 filter and am using it on a 5 gal. cube. I love this thing, it keeps the water crystal clear and even keeps the poop sucked up. Would most surely buy another one. Have had it about a month now, and would recommend for 5 gal. tanks. Works great! I am also using the media that comes with it, just added a bag of ammonia chips on top of the carbon bag. Update: After owning this filter for three months plus, I can now confirm, that this is the best HOB I have ever owned. Still recommend it highly!!!!
customer_reviews.author: buckaroogal

customer_reviews.title: Awesome filter!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great HOB filter!! Works awesome. This filter is quiet, and efficient. The replacement media is inexpensive and come in packs of three. My tank is crystal clear and well circulated. I bought a c2 for my smaller tank after letting this one run for a bit. I like it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crystal clear water
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a new 30 gallon tank, I have one other fluval on a 15 gallon and loved what it did. This filter is amazing as well, my water is always crystal clear. The filter is pretty much quite all I really here is the water cascade which is peaceful to me. Great filter, whenever I upgrade to a larger tank I'll stick with Fluval. Pro tip- Always get a filter larger then the tank you are using, If have a 30 gallon get a filter that is made for a 50 gallon.
customer_reviews.author: D.W

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: Stops working a lot, my water is always cloudy and murky looking. I have a 20G long. 2gouramis a gold dojo loach and danios. It's very quiet which I liked but that's about it. I always replace the activated charcoal and foam pad when I do water changes. There's ways sludge stuck inside of the filter. Not happy at all, expensive junk.
customer_reviews.author: kaykayflames

customer_reviews.title: Start with this HOB, avoid making mistakes.
customer_reviews.text: This is the HOB filter I should have started with. I tried two other brands and was quite displeased with the flow and the short life of the filter pads. This filter gives you the choice of using carbon or not instead of forcing it on you being built into in the filter pads. The adjustable flow rate is very useful, when there are fry in the tank I can reduce the flow and not endanger them. The biological media is always exposed to air and running water unlike one brand that I used where the bio wheel would stop spinning and dry out. I will purchase more of these for my breeder tanks.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I have had THREE of these filters and all three have burned up and stopped pumping. Not sure why. I change the filters as requested and clean the fan with a special brush for power filters. I purchased a regular carbon filter pump and have been more pleased with it than the Fluval. The Fluval was very noisy... could hear it running 3 rooms over! I have kept an aquarium for 20 years or so. I have a Cichlid tank and thought this filter would help keep the tank cleaner. The carbon filter pump does a better job!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best engineered HOB filters on the market. It is not loud at all, actually it is virtually silent. I am not sure what the issue is with other reviews claiming it to be noisy but I can tell you if you do not have the intake tube inserted correctly it causes the impeller to rattle loudly. Push your intake tube down all the way and it will stop rattling. I have had 2 for over two years now and they still preform perfectly. They are silent and my water is crystal clear and all water test show perfectly balanced conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: C2 Stopped working after 10 months, C4 after 7 months
customer_reviews.text: I have a heavily stocked 30 gallon tank, so I have both a Fluval C2 and a C4 for filtration. Fluval is quiet, does a good job with filtration, etc. but after10 months, the C2 stopped working and after 7 months the C4 stopped working! Not sure why. Need to figure out how to get a replacement via the 1 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: G B

customer_reviews.title: Noisy but functional.
customer_reviews.text: Have become a big fluval fan over the past 5 years. The C4 has great looks and functionality of filter media. As other's have reported, it is a little noisy (rattle of impeller)! Put vasaline on the impeller shaft as other's suggested, helped a little but still a little vibration noise. Been running for a couple weeks with no change in the noise. Many options with filter media which is great for HOB unit. May try a new impeller to fix the noise though. You may get a quiet one like others have posted, mine was not!!
customer_reviews.author: DARIN

customer_reviews.title: Two full months w/o even starting to cycle
customer_reviews.text: Had the filter operating on a 20 gallon tank for 2 months. It never cycled. I have to continually add ammonia binder and do 1/3 water changes ever other day. Have taken it off the 20 and put it on a 10 w/o fish but with lots of ammonia and nitrite (and a few plants) hoping to eventually get it cycled. Two months w/o cycling is crazy! I've ordered an Aquaclear.
customer_reviews.author: Spike Cover

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Had a problem with the trickle chamber, it was my problem not the filter took off the pre filter which was to fine and restricted flow. Make sure you use a coarse pre filter or none at all.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Great filter!
customer_reviews.text: This filter is great; it does what it should. It’s very easy to maintain: each compartment comes out separately and just slides back in. As others have said, it is noisy, even after lubing the impeller and impeller shady, but it does quiet down over time. It’s not 100% silent like the AquaClear, but it does make a soft hum noise. Other than the noise I love this filter and I recommend it to anyone and everyone in the fish hobby.
customer_reviews.author: Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I like that this system provides 5 tiers of filtration. Access to the different media is intuitive and thoughtful. Additionally the media volume is substantial compared to other products. Construction seems solid, and I like that the outer case is opaque allowing the movement of water trough the system to be visible.
customer_reviews.author: Jermaine Johns

customer_reviews.title: Motor bad design
customer_reviews.text: This filter will only last 2 years like mine did the shaft wears inside the motor where u can’t fix it they make u buy a whole new motor and propeller Marineland 400 is much better filter
customer_reviews.author: david pelzel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent filter but noisy as hell.
customer_reviews.text: tried a different motor (found out weaker models simply have a smaller propeller and same motor) but this crazy rattling sound is still there. I'm thinking it's a loose piece of plastic. Likely needs to be super glued. Sound is driving me crazy though
customer_reviews.author: Bumbaclot

customer_reviews.title: High maintenance
customer_reviews.text: Personal opinion. This is one of 3 similarly rated filters I have, and this one causes me the most trouble. If you plan to perform weekly maintenance on it, it's probably great, but if you plan on doing monthly maintenance be prepared for a pain every time you crack it open.
customer_reviews.author: XR19

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a Fluval canister but was tired of always having to pick it up then I came across this and it was a perfect fit. It has all the power of the canister in a very compact space. It completes the same processes as before and works perfectly for my 55 gallon.
customer_reviews.author: ccislandguy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Product worked great (while it lasted). I purchased this filter January and starting using it in June. Now mid December the motor failed. I read a couple of other reviews who mentioned this filter failing soon after usage as well. So this must be a recurring theme. I am really disappointed because this filter maintained my 50 gallon tank extremely well and now I may have to look for another product.
customer_reviews.author: s.tenorio

customer_reviews.title: I love that it has flow control.
customer_reviews.text: This filter is easy to clean, keeps my water crystal clear and I just love how you can modify the flow for whenever I add a new fish that's getting used to the current and so on. The media replacements are not expensive at all so I also live that it's not a high maintenance filter. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Darline Davila

customer_reviews.title: Good but Loud.
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad pump. Good filtering, decent flow, overall pretty nice. One drawback; it's loud. For some reason the impeller assembly is noisy. Much more so than other brands like AquaClear. Will use it as a backup.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl Kunzmann

customer_reviews.title: Great Filter
customer_reviews.text: Currently using this on my 29g tank and has been in that tank for a month now. Great water flow. I am happy with how quiet these filters are! Would buy again if I need a external filter!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron A.

customer_reviews.title: Buy It
customer_reviews.text: Great filter. It does a fantastic job of filtering. Nice part is that a little knob will poke up when the filter needs cleaning or replacement. The poly filter is on a separate rack that pulls up and removable for cleaning. The bio pellets are in a separate container that hold loose media and easily lifts off. It has another strip filter over the bio pellets for further filtering. The carbon is on a separate rack the pulls up to change. I have a C-4 on my 40 gallon and one on my 20 gallon (overkill). It keeps the water nice and clear.
customer_reviews.author: phil

customer_reviews.title: Stay away.
customer_reviews.text: Filter came with no sponges. No carbon. No ceramic media. Just a shell of the filter. Unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Erbst

customer_reviews.title: THIS THING SUCKS, AND THAT'S A GOOD THING
customer_reviews.text: I've had this over the side filter for over a year and it has continued to perform without a single problem. My wife is using it on her 37 gallon salt water tank and the nitrate levels are always good. It has a little red pop up bottom that lets you know when the sponge is full of "stuff" so you can rinse it in the sink. Unit is compartmentalized so you can leave it on the back of the tank and just pull out the various filters, media, carbon and clean or change them out. You can also choose two flow speeds by moving the intake tube from left to right, hi and low.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Beatty

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous filter
customer_reviews.text: After I bought the Fluval Filter my Tank is CRYSTAL clear after 2days. I did also cut down on my Fish feeding. I have a CRYSTAL clear Tank for the last 3 weeks ever since I bought Fluval. It;s amazing.
customer_reviews.author: newyorkchef

customer_reviews.title: Love this filter!!
customer_reviews.text: Really like it so far, easy to assemble, lots of filtration, looks great. Some filters look like cheap black plastic, this one is very well made & looks great!
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: It was great for a few weeks than now it makes loud ...
customer_reviews.text: It was great for a few weeks than now it makes loud noises and I looked that I have to lube the filter every once and a while but even so it still makes noises and such. :/ not something I'd recommend but if it works for you it works for you
customer_reviews.author: marvin

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for sand or crushed coral substrate
customer_reviews.text: This is an O.K. filter, about as noisy as others of this size and style. I would not recommend this filter if you have sand or crushed coral substrate. The pad for the trickle chamber can become easily clogged (without warning) and the unfiltered water will just bypass it. Also, the main filter pad change indicator doesn't seem to function properly. If you have gravel bottom and keep an eye on the multiple filter pads, this should work well for you.
customer_reviews.author: MWorsa

customer_reviews.title: you won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The features and design of this filter are outstanding. We received ours this week and it is super quiet - aside from seeing the water move you have to put your ear next to it to even know it's running. The unit self-primed rather easily and the water flow is easy to adjust. The different filter compartments are easy to access and can be changed or cleaned independently. The pop-up indicator for the foam filter told us we needed to replace/clean it and all we did was slide out that compartment, remove the foam pad, rinse it out, put it back in its cage and slide it back into the unit - all while the filter was running.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Great Filter!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product as a second filter on my 55-gallon freshwater tank for over a year. I travel on occasion, and can sometimes be away for a couple of weeks at a time. I don't want to come home after a trip sometime and find my fish dead because of a filter failure, so I use two different filters for redundancy. This filter performs well, is reliable, and is easy to maintain. It disassembles quickly and easily for cleaning. The replacement filter pads are reasonably priced and available right here from Amazon. I will soon be setting-up another freshwater tank, and will be purchasing another Fluval C4. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: A good filter that could be better
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this filter and usually and very happy with Fluval products. But, with this filter I could not get the pump to work right out of the box. After messing with the impeller for over an hour I was finally able to get it going. Now that the pump is running the filter has been excellent and does a great job. I love the design and the ability to change up the different filter media. It is also nearly completely silent as long as the tank water level is right up the top. Overall would have rated it a full five stars if it worked right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best
customer_reviews.text: best hangon filter i have ever used, super easy. it made everything in the tank grow much healthier. i would recommend to any aquarium hobbyist.
customer_reviews.author: gabriel diaz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Power Filter
customer_reviews.text: This filter is so much easier to clean and take care of compared to the Aquaclear Power Filter series, of which I own several. It's a snap to pop out the mechanical foam pad and clean while the power filter is still running, instead of having to take everything out to get the small foam pad out of the bottom of the filter to rinse it out or replace. This is also one of the first power filters I've seen with trickle filtration build inside which is becoming very popular with larger tanks. Totally worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't Prime so it wouldn't perform.
customer_reviews.text: I read the instructions over and over again trying desperately to get this filter to prime, but no luck. I paid $38 for this filter then the next day it was listed as $22, cheapening it further. Can't tell a book by its cover as it comes off as a high-end prodeuct but performs as a low-end device.
customer_reviews.author: adamh636

customer_reviews.title: Quiet. Absolutely works.
customer_reviews.text: After numerous filters that were noisy and clogged I was desperate. A kid told me he has 7 tanks in his bedroom with these filters and he sleeps without hearing them. I got one and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanine

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I read A LOT of reviews before purchasing this. I am very happy with it! It is similar to the old style Aquaclear filters that I have been using for many years. I have a 16 gallon bow front that needed an upgrade. This is just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: pippintwosie

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working at 90 Days
customer_reviews.text: I used this product on a 65 gallon tank, and it worked just fine for the last several months. It was quiet, efficient, and unobtrusive. Unfortunately it completely stopped working 90 days to the day since I ordered it. That was a disappointment as these filters should last more than three months. The good news is they carry a two year warranty which I will attempt to use. Updates will be forthcoming.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Customizable HOB filter
customer_reviews.text: Filter has plenty of space to put your own bags of media inside. Noise level isn't that bad. Flow is controllable, but pretty high even on the lowest setting.
customer_reviews.author: Allen G.

customer_reviews.title: A few tips make it so much better
customer_reviews.text: Works well as others have stated, but here is two huge tips. 1. Clean the black separator between the intake well and the filter to restore flow to the trickle chamber. It actually slides out of itself if you take a second to look at it. 2. You can peel apart the stock media to rinse the foam and floss separate or even to throw the floss away. It rinses better if removed. I do this after the first few rinses. I use this with a Fluval 306 on a 40 gallon breeder tank with two plecos and some other bottom dwellers. My water looks awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Dan P

customer_reviews.title: Bargain at $25.00
customer_reviews.text: I've had this filter for a couple of weeks now, so ready to review. I wish that I had taken before and after pics, 10 gal. tank, came with an aqueon filter. Didn't keep the tank clean at all! It is now crystal clear. The filtration medias are readily accessable for cleaning and or changing, I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy G.

customer_reviews.title: Love this power filter it keeps my water crystal clear
customer_reviews.text: Love this power filter it keeps my water crystal clear, although I am using it in a 10 gallon tank. (I know! Overkill) but it does the job. I could of went with a smaller power filter but I like the fact that this filter was capable of holding different types of bio-media in one compartment along with a wet dry space. big plus first of its kind
customer_reviews.author: AReyes

customer_reviews.title: Poor design and irresponsible customer support
customer_reviews.text: Although the FLuval C4 filter has the appearance of a well designed Aquarium filter, the Aquaclear series filters outperform the Fluval C4; The C4 unit is extremely noisy. I had to put it on a timer during the evening to hear the TV. Customer service replaced the motor, the replacement was equally as noisy. I would not recommend this filter. I replaced it at my cost for an Aquaclear unit that is a proven design and quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Avidreader

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I love this filter! I spent the price of a side filter and got everything in it that a cannister filter has. It is so easy to clean and doesn't take long at all.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: Bought 4 of them 3 months ago have replaced 3 propellers and the 4th one's motor locked up noisiest filter i have ever owned also hardly any room for mechanical filtration never starts back up without taking the motor off is made very cheap so friend don't get this ( true story
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Wamer

customer_reviews.title: A great filter, quiet. But only for 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: It's quiet, filters well and the supplies (filters etc) are affordable. Compared to the Aqueon and Marineland, this one is quieter. But only for 3 months!. After 3 months it started to make a vibrating noise. Either the motor of the rotor assembly is coming apart. Enough noise to wake you up at night. I had to downgrade my rating from 5 stars to 2 stars after 3 months. If I cannot get that noise to go away, the filter goes in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Tizona

customer_reviews.title: Only aqua clear is better. Best beginner filter.
customer_reviews.text: Great filter. Used one for over 5 years. Never cleaned it, changed filter of did water changes. Aquarium parameters on point. The pump finally gave out and bought this one.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Michael Owens

customer_reviews.title: Best filter ever for my 10 gallon
customer_reviews.text: Best filter ever for my 10 gallon. Tried other types and the water was always cloudy. Not with this filter!
customer_reviews.author: blue

customer_reviews.title: Easiest hob filter to clean
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install and clean. I don't even have to tale it off the tank to do a quick clean or simple media swap. Update I now have 2 c4 filters. It's so easy my 9 year old has been able to clean his own filter.
customer_reviews.author: Dreamer

customer_reviews.title: Filter this
customer_reviews.text: Super filter, it is compact, it's bigger in the back than my Aqueon , but there is less of it in the tank, has multiple filtering methods. Quiet, strong flow, I'm using it with saltwater, I didn't really have a spot for a canister, and this seemed like a good choice. The intake is easily adjusted in length and flow rate. I also like the way it looks, not exactly a performance requirement, but it looks good.
customer_reviews.author: kevin koffel

customer_reviews.title: Best HOB Filter!
customer_reviews.text: Best HOB filter available! I love this filter. If you don't want to run carbon you can buy one of those Seachem products already in a bag, like phosguard or my favorite Purigen. I ran two of these all the time on my reef tank(50 gallon) and they did a great job. I recommend taking it off the tank every 2/3 months and give it a clean out. Never had a problem with one losing prime or leaking! Filter pads do a great job as well.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B

product_meta.title: Fluval C Power Filter
product_meta.description:
Style:C4| Product Packaging:Standard Packaging14003 Size: C4 (Between 40 and 70 gallons) Features: -Power filter. -5 stages of filtration: 2 mechanical, 1 chemical and 2 biological stages for top performance. -Equipped with Poly/Foam, Activated Carbon, C-nodes and drip tray pad. -Biological filtration is super charged for fast and efficient nitrification. Filter Type: -Power. Filter Placement: -External. Generic Dimensions: -C2 Pounds Weight: 1.92 lbs. -C2 Pounds 8'' H x 6'' W x 4.5'' D. -C3 Pounds Weight: 2.16 lbs. -C3 Pounds 8'' H x 7'' W x 4.5'' D.

AMAZON.COM





Fluval C Series Power Filter MAXIMUM VERSATILITY AND PREMIUM PERFORMANCE
Engineered to create superior water quality, the Fluval C Power Filter provides extensive 5-stage filtration for outstanding results. The Power Filter is designed to provide maximum surface area and optimum dwell times in all stages of the filtration process.

NEW 5 STAGE FILTRATION SYSTEM 
Stage 1 & 2: Mechanical- Poly/Foam Pad Effective mechanical filtration is essential for efficient chemical and biological filtration. The large surface area of the Poly/Foam pad effectively performs two stages of Mechanical filtration. The first stage of porous foam traps large particles and the second stage of dense polyester captures fine debris.

Stage 3: Chemical- Activated Carbon Insert The Fluval Activated Carbon Filter Insert contains 100% premium research grade carbon, which provides large amounts of surface area for adsorption of undesirable impurities. The activated carbon filter insert removes unwanted odors, discoloration and impurities, resulting in a crystal clear aquarium.

Stage 4: Biological-Bio-Screen An additional hydraulic circuit conveys part of the intake water to the Bio-Screen placed at the top of the Trickle Chamber cover. Fluval’s Bio-Screen removes any debris before dripping into the biological chamber. It also ensures that the water pumped to the Trickle Chamber is evenly spread through all areas before it drips on the C-Nodes, which are contained in the chamber. The motion of water dropping slowly through the grids mimics the rain.

Stage 5: Biological- C-Nodes The surface of the C-Nodes is made up of a complex pore system that provides optimal living space for beneficial bacteria to thrive and enhance the removal of ammonia and nitrites. The new “Star Shape” provides a higher filtration surface and more biological power than a traditional cartridge, resulting in a healthy aquarium environment.

PATENTED REFILTRATION SYSTEM
Sometimes delicate fish and plants require a more gentle water flow. Fluvals’ patented re-filtration system allows you to control the flow rate without compromising filtration efficiency. When the flow rate is reduced, up to 50% of the water within the filter chamber is re-processed multiple times. More impurities are filtered out, creating a healthier tank with sparkling clean and clear water

WHAT’S IN THE BOX?
1. Filter Cover 2. Filter Case 3. Leveling Device 4. C-Nodes 5. “U” Tube 6. Telescopic Intake Tube 7. Bio-Screen 8. Mechanical Frame 9. Chemical Basket 10. Impeller Cover Assembly 11. Impeller 12. Biological Trickle Chamber with Cover 13. Poly/Foam Pad 14. Activated Carbon 15. Motor Unit with Seal Ring

MEDIA AND ACCESSORIES
MEDIA REPLACEMENT
Fluval Poly/Foam: Replace poly/foam every 4-6 weeks.

Biological C-Nodes: Replace half the quantity every 6 months. Never replace all c-nodes at once.

Activated Carbon Insert: Replace Activated Carbon every 2-4 weeks.

Bio-Screen: Replace Bio Screen every 2-3 months.

Motor O-Ring: Replace once a year to prevent leaking.

POWER FILTER MAINTENANCE
For optimal performance it is recommended to clean the impeller cover assembly once a year. The motor should be thoroughly cleaned every three months. Always unplug the Fluval C Power Filter prior to cleaning. Remove cover, filter media and discard water remaining in the filter case. Thoroughly rinse collected debris from the case, impeller cover and impeller assembly using clear lukewarm water. The intake "U" tube and extension tube can be cleaned with a filter stem brush to remove any buildup of deposits. When all parts have been cleaned and thoroughly rinsed, reassemble filter and replace any scheduled media. Install the filter once again back on the aquarium making sure that the filter is tipped slightly forward. Then fill the Fluval C filter box with aquarium water. Finally plug the filter into an electrical outlet and the Fluval C Power Filter will self-prime and begin running in a few seconds. 

Model Fluval C2 Power Filter Fluval C3 Power Filter Fluval C4 Power Filter Aquarium Capacity 10 to 30 US Gallons 20 to 50 US Gallons 40 to 70 US Gallons Dimensions 4.5 x 6 x 8 inches 4.5 x 7 x 8 inches 6 x 8.2 x 8.5 inches Stages 5-stage filtration 5-stage filtration 5-stage filtration Max Flow Rate 119 US Gal/H 153 US Gal/H 264 US Gal/H 

FLUVAL C FILTRATION/MEDIA
Fluval Poly Foam Pad - 3-Pack FLUVAL POLY FOAM PAD - 3-PACK
The Fluval C Poly Foam Pad Replacement Media, 3-pack, has two sides that combine to provide thorough and effective mechanical filtration. The Fluval C Poly Foam captures large particles of debris on it porous foam side, while the polyester side filters out finer debris and contaminants.

Fluval Bio-Screen - 3-Pack FLUVAL BIO-SCREEN - 3-PACK
The Fluval C Bio-Screen Replacement Media provides massive biological surface area for friendly bacteria to colonize. It also works to block debris and evenly distribute the water flow before it drips into the Power Filter's biological trickle chamber.

Fluval Carbon - 3-Pack FLUVAL CARBON - 3-PACK
The Fluval C Activated Carbon Replacement Media, 3-pack, is capable of adsorbing most liquefied impurities and dyes present in aquarium water. The carbon works to remove odors and discoloration from your tank. Fluval C Activated Carbon is suitable for freshwater or marine aquariums, but was exclusively designed for the Fluval C Power Filter. 

Fluval Zeo-Carb - 3-Pack FLUVAL ZEO-CARB - 3-PACK
The Fluval C Zeo-Carb Filter Insert combines ammonia removal with ultra-grade carbon purification. Working together, these highly effective media eliminate liquefied impurities, odors and discoloration, while simultaneously removing toxic ammonia, for a clean, healthy aquarium. 

Fluval Ammonia Remover - 3-Pack FLUVAL AMMONIA REMOVER - 3-PACK
The Fluval C Ammonia Remover Media, 2-pack, is ideal for new or heavily populated freshwater aquariums. It removes and controls harmful ammonia and nitrite, which helps reduce stress on fish. Use this product to provide a healthy environment when setting up a new aquarium or maintaining one that contains a high fish stock.

Fluval C-Nodes FLUVAL C-NODES
luval C-Nodes feature a complex pore system where beneficial bacterial will thrive. Their star shapes provide a higher filtration surface and more biological power than most biological media, resulting in a healthy aquarium environment. The Fluval C-Nodes are for use with the Fluval C Power Filters. 


FLUVAL WATER CARE


Aquarium supplements and conditioners are a convenient way to create water conditions that mimics those found in nature; they make water safe for aquarium use by removing harmful toxins, help plants grow by providing them the necessary trace elements and are an easy way to maintain water quality in a tank by removing waste and adding beneficial bacteria to the environment. Developed by our dedicated team of specialists and manufactured in Canada at our state-of-the-art liquids facility, new Fluval water treatments are scientifically formulated to produce clean, clear and safe living conditions for aquarium fish and plants.


Hagen Fluval Water Conditioner for Aquariums HAGEN FLUVAL WATER CONDITIONER FOR AQUARIUMS
Fluval Water Conditioner is highly efficient comprehensive water conditioner that makes tap water safe for fish by removing chlorine and chloramines and neutralizing toxic heavy metals. Fluval Water Conditioner features a patented stress relief formula and is also effective at protecting scales and fins and preventing the inflammation. 

Hagen Fluval Biological Enhancer for Aquariums HAGEN FLUVAL BIOLOGICAL ENHANCER FOR AQUARIUMS
Fluval Biological Enhancer is a responsive biological aquarium supplement that ensures that all aquariums are immediately inoculated with a powerful team of beneficial bacteria, providing a safe biological habitat for your fish. These highly effective micro-organisms will create a biological flora that quickly metabolizes lethal ammonia and nitrite.

Hagen Fluval Biological Cleaner for Aquariums HAGEN FLUVAL BIOLOGICAL CLEANER FOR AQUARIUMS
Fluval Biological Cleaner helps reduce aquarium maintenance by helping to reduce waste in gravel, power filters, decoration and on interior aquarium surfaces. Fluval Biological Cleaner rapidly reduces organic waste from overfeeding, fish waste, and other decaying material such as plant leaves.

Hagen Fluval Plant Micro Nutrient for Aquariums HAGEN FLUVAL PLANT MICRO NUTRIENT FOR AQUARIUMS
Fluval Plant Micro Nutrients is a balanced supplement essential for healthy, vibrant aquarium plants. Tap water is often devoid of necessary trace elements required by aquatic plants and plants rapidly deplete available micro-nutrients, regular supplementation is necessary.

Fluval Quick Clear for Aquarium Water Treatment FLUVAL QUICK CLEAR FOR AQUARIUM WATER TREATMENT
Fluval Quick Clear effectively helps eliminate undesirable particles that cause cloudy aquarium water, such as suspended organic and inorganic particles, dirt, slit and fine sand. Its special formulation clumps together particulate waste by ionic attraction, vastly enhancing filtration absorption and creating crystal clear water. 

Fluval Clarify Bio for Aquarium Water Treatment FLUVAL CLARIFY BIO FOR AQUARIUM WATER TREATMENT
Fluval Bio Clear contains fast-acting enzymes that naturally clarify cloudy aquarium water. Its biological formulation effectively clears cloudy water by rapidly consuming free floating organic food sources, proteins and other organic elements. Bio Clear is recommended for clarifying cloudy water caused by new tank syndrome.
feature_bullets: Power filter featuring 5 stages of filtration for aquariums between 40 to 70 gallons
Equipped with cleaning indicator for when the polyfoam needs to be rinsed
Clip on filter; Quick and easy maintenance
Helps provide a stress-free environment; Works to maintain refreshing crisp water

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
